title: Separation methods for methanol and water

content.question: Substance Lewis Diagram Molar Mass (<math alttext="grams per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>g/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) Density (<math alttext="grams per milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>g/mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) Boiling Point (<math alttext="Kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) Methanol 32 0.79 338 Water 18 1.0 373 When methanol and water are mixed together, they form a homogeneous mixture. Based on the information in the table above, which of the following would be the best procedure for separating a mixture of methanol and water?

skill.text: 2.C: Identify experimental procedures that are aligned to a scientific question (which may include a sketch of a lab setup).
